extension.title: Browser extension
items: Can I suggest a technology to be added?
Anyone can add a new technology: refer to the documentation on how to contribute. If you're not a developer and don't have access to one, please create an issue on GitHub.
Where can I report a bug or request a new feature?
Please create an issue on GitHub.
How does the extension work?
The extension inspects HTML, scripts, cookies, and headers of pages you visit, looking for technology fingerprints. For technical details, refer to the documentation.
Can I hide technologies on my website from Wappalyzer?

Although in many cases it's possible to change a software application's output to obfuscate its charactaristics, it's often impractical and unnecessary. If you're worried about security, ensure your software is always up-to-date.
What information do you collect?

We collect information in accordance with our privacy policy. By default, when you visit a website, we record the domain name and identified technologies in a way that can't be traced back to you. You can disable this behaviour in the extension's settings.

datasets.title: Datasets
items: What information is included in the datasets?

Our datasets are lists of websites that use certain technologies. Where available, version numbers and languages are included as well as a traffic indicator ('hits'). A free sample is provided with every quote.
What segmentation options are available?
Currently, datasets can be filtered by language and top-level domain. More segmentation options will be made available in the future.
Do you supply company or contact information?
No, not at this time.
How is the information being collected?

We collect information through the browser extensions and web crawlers. Our methods ensure only actively visited websites are included in the datasets. Data is corroborated across multiple sources to ensure accuracy.
How fresh is the data?
The data is being updated and added to continuously and is never more than three months old.
How do you determine website traffic?

Website traffic is tracked using the browser extensions. The install base provides a large enough sample set to determine which websites receive more traffic than others, resulting in a relative traffic marker referred to as 'hits'.
Can I use a different payment method?
Please contact us if you wish to pay via bank transfer or Bitcoin, or discuss options.
What is your refund policy?
If you're not satisfied with the quality of a dataset for any reason, we will issue a full refund.

api.title: APIs
items: How is the information being collected?

We collect information through the browser extensions and web crawlers. Our methods ensure only actively visited websites are included. Data is corroborated across multiple sources to ensure accuracy.
How fresh is the data?
The data is being updated and added to continuously and is never more than three months old.
How do you determine website traffic?

Website traffic is tracked using the browser extensions. The install base provides a large enough sample set to determine which websites receive more traffic than others, resulting in a relative traffic marker referred to as 'hits'.
Do you offer a free trial?
You can use the demo API key to try out the APIs before buying.
Can I use a different payment method?
We only accept credit card for subscriptions.
What is your refund policy?

Subscriptions are generally non-refundable. However, if you're dissatisfied with the quality of our offering we will either work with you to resolve the issue, reinstate your quota or issue a pro-rata refund.
